ai.definition: Artificial Intelligence enables machines to mimic human intelligence such as learning, reasoning, and decision-making.
ai.uses: Healthcare diagnosis, finance fraud detection, chatbots, robotics, and smart assistants.
ai.working: AI works using algorithms trained on large datasets through machine learning and neural networks.
ai.benefits: Increases efficiency, reduces human error, automates repetitive tasks.
ai.future: AI will focus on ethical intelligence, human-AI collaboration, and explainable systems.

machine learning.definition: Machine Learning is a subset of AI that allows systems to learn from data without explicit programming.
machine learning.uses: Prediction systems, recommendation engines, image recognition.
machine learning.working: Models learn patterns from historical data and improve with experience.
machine learning.future: ML will power autonomous systems and personalized technologies.

deep learning.definition: Deep Learning uses multi-layered neural networks to analyze complex data.
deep learning.uses: Speech recognition, computer vision, self-driving cars.
deep learning.working: Processes data through layered neural networks inspired by the human brain.
deep learning.benefits: Handles large and complex data efficiently.
deep learning.future: Deeper models with less data dependency and higher accuracy.

data science.definition: Data Science extracts insights and knowledge from structured and unstructured data.
data science.uses: Business analytics, healthcare analysis, market prediction.
data science.working: Combines statistics, programming, and domain knowledge.
data science.future: Automated data science and real-time analytics.

big data.definition: Big Data refers to extremely large datasets that traditional systems cannot handle.
big data.uses: Customer analytics, fraud detection, IoT data processing.
big data.working: Uses distributed systems like Hadoop and Spark.

cloud computing.definition: Cloud computing provides on-demand computing resources over the internet.
cloud computing.uses: Hosting applications, data storage, AI deployment.
cloud computing.working: Resources are delivered via remote data centers.

edge computing.definition: Edge computing processes data closer to the source instead of centralized servers.
edge computing.uses: IoT devices, smart cities, autonomous vehicles.
edge computing.working: Data is processed locally at edge nodes.

blockchain.definition: Blockchain is a decentralized digital ledger technology.
blockchain.working: Transactions are stored in immutable blocks across nodes.

cryptocurrency.definition: Cryptocurrency is a digital currency secured by cryptography.

cybersecurity.definition: Cybersecurity protects systems and networks from digital attacks.
cybersecurity.uses: Data protection, network security, risk management.
cybersecurity.working: Uses encryption, firewalls, and intrusion detection.

internet of things.definition: IoT connects physical devices to the internet for data exchange.
internet of things.uses: Smart homes, healthcare monitoring, industry automation.
internet of things.working: Devices collect and transmit data via networks.
internet of things.future: Massive IoT ecosystems with AI integration.

robotics.definition: Robotics deals with the design and operation of robots.
robotics.working: Robots combine sensors, control systems, and AI.

augmented reality.definition: AR overlays digital content onto the real world.
augmented reality.working: Uses cameras and sensors to enhance real views.

metaverse.definition: The Metaverse is a shared virtual digital space.
metaverse.working: Combines VR, AR, blockchain, and AI.

quantum computing.definition: Quantum computing uses quantum mechanics to process data.

5g.definition: 5G is the fifth generation of mobile networks.

devops.definition: DevOps integrates development and operations teams.

software engineering.definition: Software engineering applies engineering principles to software development.

web development.definition: Web development builds and maintains websites.

artificial neural networks.definition: ANNs are computing systems inspired by biological neural networks.

natural language processing.definition: NLP enables machines to understand human language.

computer vision.definition: Computer vision allows machines to interpret images and videos.

ethical hacking.definition: Ethical hacking tests systems for vulnerabilities.

ui ux design.definition: UI/UX focuses on user interface and experience design.

game development.definition: Game development creates interactive digital games.

embedded systems.definition: Embedded systems are dedicated computer systems within devices.

automation.definition: Automation uses technology to perform tasks with minimal human input.

digital transformation.definition: Digital transformation integrates digital technology into businesses.
